revised_title: A Study of Variability and Correlation of the Hand: Measuring the First Joint of Fingers in Women
tldr: This study investigates the variability and correlation of the first joint of the fingers in 551 women, measuring the dimensions of the right and left hands. The results show that the right hand is larger than the left hand, and all the first joints for the left hand are more variable than the corresponding joints for the right hand. This suggests that there may be greater adaptation and selection occurring in the right hand.
